snippet: The Supreme Court should make the government pay when prosecutors ignore the Constitution and convict defendants as a result of prosecutorial misconduct.
abstract: Editorial observes that request by exonerated men Earl Truvia and Gregory Bright to sue office of New Orleans Dist Atty Harry Connick could, if granted, correct 2011 Supreme Court ruling excusing prosecutors from liability in such cases; urges Supreme Court to give Truvia and Bright chance to prove their case and help ensure that human rights are respected in court.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should make the government pay when prosecutors ignore the Constitution and convict defendants as a result of prosecutorial misconduct.

headline.print_headline: How to Force Prosecutors to Play Fair
headline.main: How to Force Prosecutors to Play Fair
